servinfo.title: Test 3: Checking the Turbocharged Air Inlet Circuit

testgroup.ptxt: Engine stopped: Check the low and high pressure air circuits for leaks (air leaks in or out, before and after the turbocharger). Look for parts of the system that are abnormally greasy, indicating leakage.

item.ptxt: The condition and fitting of the ducts (foreign bodies, clogged, disconnected, pinched, broken, holed, cut, tightness of the mounting bolts, etc.).
The presence, condition and fitting of the seals.
The presence and tightening of the clamps.
The fitting of the boost pressure sensor.

testgroup.question: Is there in good condition?

item.ptxt: The air filter unit inlet and outlet are not blocked.
The condition and the assembly of the air filter unit (disconnected, broken, with holes, etc.).
The cleanliness, conformity and the non-distortion of the filter element.
The condition of the inlet throttle valve.
The tightness of the mounting bolts.

testgroup.ptxt: Check that there is no leak on the exhaust manifold, in particular at the exhaust manifold/turbocharger interface. Check the exhaust system: apply test 1 referring to Test 1: Exhaust System Check:F9Q .
testgroup.question: Is there in good condition?

testgroup.ptxt: Check the condition of the intercooler:

item.ptxt: Leaks (vehicle stationary, stabilize the engine speed between 3500 rpm and 4000 rpm and check that there are no leaks).
